libshapedraw

Class LibShapeDraw

  • java.lang.Object
    • libshapedraw.LibShapeDraw

  • public class LibShapeDraw
extends java.lang.Object
    Main entry point for the LibShapeDraw API.

    Instantiating this class will automatically register it with the internal controller. Shapes added using addShape will be rendered. LSDEventListeners added using addEventListener will receive events.

    Multiple API instances can coexist, each with their own settings and state.

    See the demos in projects/demos for sample usage.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LibShapeDraw()
      Create a new API instance, automatically registering it with the internal controller.
      LibShapeDraw(java.lang.String ownerId)
      The ownerId is optional: an arbitrary identifier for the mod that owns this API instance.

    • Method Detail

      • unregister

        public boolean unregister()
        Permanently unregister the entire API instance. It will no longer render its Shapes or dispatch LSDEvents to registered listeners.

        Normally there's no need to ever do this. It generally makes more sense to call setVisible(false) or clearShapes() to temporarily shut things down.

      • getVersion

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Deprecated. use ApiInfo

      • isControllerInitialized

        @Deprecated
public static boolean isControllerInitialized()
        Deprecated. use verifyInitialized()
        Returns:
        true if the backend controller is all set up. If false, the cause is likely one of: a) LiteLoader or Forge is disabled/missing; b) mod_LibShapeDraw is disabled/missing; or c) LiteLoader hasn't instantiated mod_LibShapeDraw yet because it's too early in the mod lifecycle. Wait until the init stage or later.

      • verifyInitialized

        public LibShapeDraw verifyInitialized()
        Optional sanity check for mods to make sure that LiteLoader or Forge has successfully initialized LibShapeDraw. Throws an exception if not.

        This is the only LibShapeDraw API method that has a restriction on when you can call it. Always wait until at least the initialization stage.

        In other words, do not call verifyInitialized() from your mod's constructor. If you do, the exception may be thrown depending on the order that LiteLoader or Forge chooses to instantiate the various mod classes.

      • getMinecraftAccess

        public MinecraftAccess getMinecraftAccess()
        Get a MinecraftAccess instance for calling obfuscated Minecraft methods.

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Whether this API instance's shapes will be rendered. Defaults to true. When set to false, the shapes still exist. They just won't be rendered until this property is set to true again.

        To show/hide individual shapes rather than the entire shape collection, use Shape.setVisible(boolean).

      • setVisible

        public LibShapeDraw setVisible(boolean visible)
        Whether this API instance's shapes will be rendered. Defaults to true. When set to false, the shapes still exist. They just won't be rendered until this property is set to true again.

        To show/hide individual shapes rather than the entire shape collection, use Shape.setVisible(boolean).

      • isVisibleWhenHidingGui

        public boolean isVisibleWhenHidingGui()
        Whether this API instance's shapes are considered part of the game world (true) or part of the GUI (false, default).
        See Also:
        setVisibleWhenHidingGui(boolean)

      • setVisibleWhenHidingGui

        public LibShapeDraw setVisibleWhenHidingGui(boolean visibleWhenHidingGui)
        Whether this API instance's shapes are considered part of the game world (true) or part of the GUI (false, default).

        If set to true, the shapes owned by this API instance are rendered regardless of whether the GUI is visible. In other words, the shapes are considered part of the game world rather than part of the GUI.

        If set to false (default), the shapes are considered part of the GUI. They will be appropriately hidden when the user presses F1 to hide the GUI.

        See also setVisible(boolean), which overrides this property when set.

      • getShapes

        public java.util.Set<Shape> getShapes()
        Get a read-only view of the set of shapes registered to this API instance. To modify this set use addShape, removeShape, and clearShapes.

      • addShape

        public LibShapeDraw addShape(Shape shape)
        Register a Shape to be rendered by this API instance.

        Thread safety is not guaranteed. To avoid non-deterministic behavior, only call this method from the main Minecraft thread.

        Returns:
        the instance (for method chaining)

      • removeShape

        public LibShapeDraw removeShape(Shape shape)
        Unregister a Shape, no longer rendering it.

        If the Shape has Colors or ShapeTransforms that are busy animating, they will continue to do so even after the Shape is unregistered. The animations can be manually stopped using animateStop, or simply allowed to expire normally (if non-looping).

        Animations are not automatically stopped here because it is perfectly valid (and often desired, for synchronized animation) for multiple Shapes to share Color/ShapeTransform instances.

        Attempting to remove a shape that is not part of this API instance's shape collection is allowed but won't do anything.

        Thread safety is not guaranteed. To avoid non-deterministic behavior, only call this method from the main Minecraft thread.

        See also Shape.setVisible(boolean) for an alternate way of preventing a shape from rendering. Generally, removeShape should be called if the shape will never be rendered again. If the shape just needs to be hidden temporarily, use setVisible.

        Returns:
        the instance (for method chaining)

      • clearShapes

        public LibShapeDraw clearShapes()
        Unregister all Shapes owned by this API instance, no longer rendering them.

        Any animations affecting the Shapes are not automatically stopped. See removeShape(libshapedraw.shape.Shape)'s documentation for more details.

        Thread safety is not guaranteed. To avoid non-deterministic behavior, only call this method from the main Minecraft thread.

        See also setVisible(boolean) for an alternate way of preventing all shapes from rendering. Generally, clearShapes should be called if the current shapes will never be rendered again. If the shapes just need to be hidden temporarily, use setVisible.

        Returns:
        the instance (for method chaining)

      • getEventListeners

        public java.util.Set<LSDEventListener> getEventListeners()
        Get a read-only view of the set of event listeners associated with this API instance. To modify this set use addEventListener, removeEventListener, and clearEventListeners.

        Thread safety is not guaranteed. To avoid non-deterministic behavior, only call this method from the main Minecraft thread.

      • addEventListener

        public LibShapeDraw addEventListener(LSDEventListener listener)
        Register an event listener to receive LSDEvents.

        Thread safety is not guaranteed. To avoid non-deterministic behavior, only call this method from the main Minecraft thread.

        Returns:
        the instance (for method chaining)

      • removeEventListener

        public LibShapeDraw removeEventListener(LSDEventListener listener)
        Unregister an event listener. It will no longer receive LSDEvents.

        Normally there is no need to manually unregister event listeners, but this method is here if needed.

        Attempting to remove an event listener that is not registered to this API instance is allowed but won't do anything.

        Thread safety is not guaranteed. To avoid non-deterministic behavior, only call this method from the main Minecraft thread.

        Returns:
        the instance (for method chaining)

      • clearEventListeners

        public LibShapeDraw clearEventListeners()
        Unregister all event listeners that were registered to this API instance.

        Normally there is no need to manually unregister event listeners, but this method is here if needed.

        Thread safety is not guaranteed. To avoid non-deterministic behavior, only call this method from the main Minecraft thread.

        Returns:
        the instance (for method chaining)

      • debugDump

        public boolean debugDump()
        Output the complete state of all LibShapeDraw API instances, including this one, to (minecraft-dir)/mods/LibShapeDraw/LibShapeDraw.log.
        Returns:
        false if logging was disabled by user preference. Logging is enabled by default, however.

      • getInstanceId

        public java.lang.String getInstanceId()
        Get the unique id assigned to this API instance by the internal controller. E.g.: "LibShapeDraw#0".
